title: Change in momentum from force equation

content.prompt: The force F exerted on a ball during a collision with a wall is given as a function of time t by the equation F(t) = αt - βt 2 , where α = 400 N/s and β = 4000 N/s 2 . The ball first contacts the wall at t = 0, and the collision lasts for 0.10 s. What is the magnitude of the change in momentum of the ball?

choices.label: The change in momentum of the ball cannot be determined without knowing the mass of the ball.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
